questions.question: What are the central problems of an economy?

answers.a: What to produce, how to produce, and for whom to produce
answers.b: How to distribute resources, how to allocate goods, and how to stabilize prices
answers.c: How to achieve economic growth, how to reduce unemployment, and how to control inflation
answers.d: How to balance trade, how to manage foreign exchange, and how to regulate markets

questions.question: Distinguish between explicit and implicit cost.

answers.a: Explicit cost is the cost of production, while implicit cost is the cost of capital
answers.b: Explicit cost is the cost of labor, while implicit cost is the cost of materials
answers.c: Explicit cost is the cost that is directly paid, while implicit cost is the cost that is not directly paid
answers.d: Explicit cost is the cost of marketing, while implicit cost is the cost of research and development

answers.b: The point at which a firm starts producing due to low costs

questions.question: Explain the conditions for profit maximization of a firm.

answers.a: When marginal revenue equals marginal cost, and marginal cost is rising
answers.b: When marginal revenue equals marginal cost, and marginal cost is falling
answers.c: When average revenue equals average cost, and average cost is rising
answers.d: When average revenue equals average cost, and average cost is falling

questions.question: Illustrate why the demand curve in perfect competition is perfectly elastic.

answers.a: Because firms can sell as much as they want at the market price
answers.b: Because firms can sell as little as they want at the market price
answers.c: Because firms can set their own prices
answers.d: Because firms have no control over prices

questions.question: Describe the fiscal policy measures to control an inflationary situation.

answers.a: Increase government spending and cut taxes
answers.b: Decrease government spending and increase taxes
answers.c: Increase money supply and reduce interest rates
answers.d: Decrease money supply and increase interest rates

questions.question: Examine the advantages of protectionism in international trade.

answers.a: Protectionism promotes domestic industries, increases employment, and reduces trade deficits
answers.b: Protectionism reduces domestic industries, decreases employment, and increases trade deficits
answers.c: Protectionism has no effect on domestic industries, employment, or trade deficits
answers.d: Protectionism promotes foreign industries, increases employment, and reduces trade surpluses

questions.question: What is meant by BOP? What are the measures to correct disequilibrium in BOP?

answers.a: BOP refers to the balance of payments, and measures to correct disequilibrium include devaluation, tariffs, and quotas
answers.b: BOP refers to the balance of trade, and measures to correct disequilibrium include subsidies, taxes, and exchange rate adjustments
answers.c: BOP refers to the balance of services, and measures to correct disequilibrium include investment, aid, and migration
answers.d: BOP refers to the balance of capital, and measures to correct disequilibrium include monetary policy, fiscal policy, and supply-side policies
